page.title: 08UPPER TERRYVALE FARM.
page.content: Mr Ritchie owns{Upper Terryvale farm } which covers 350 acres and keeps beef- cattle and sheep.He has 350 Hereford Cross_Fresian cows which he keeps for 18 months to 2 years before selling. He also keeps 300 sheep during winter. The main crop grown is barley for feeding the cattle but he also grows silage,hay and turnips for feed. Pigeons and rabbits are a serious pest to crops and are dealt with in a variety of ways i.e. using life_like scarecrows and gassing and shooting rabbits. Busy times of the year are spring,when putting in the crops,harvest_time and bringing in the winter feed.It is not unusual for Mr Ritchie to work through from 6.30am till late at night.
